hints.content:
Let's start by visualizing a $180\degree$ rotation about line $m$. That's the same as a $2$-dimensional reflection.



[[☃ image 1]]

From our cross-section of the 3D object, we see the figure will have a radius of $3$ units and a diameter of $6$ units at its widest part.

options.alt: An equilateral triangle with a base of three units and a height of five units. There is a dashed line, m, that overlaps the height.

hints.content:
A right triangle rotated about one of its legs results in a cone.



[[☃ image 1]]

The radius is perpendicular to the axis of rotation. Which measurement forms the radius?

options.alt: A cone with a dashed line, m, that goes through the center of the base to the apex. The dashed line is the height of a right triangle that has a base of three units and a height of five units. The cone represents the outcome of a rotation of the triangle around line m.

hints.content: The 3D object will be a cone with a radius of $3$ units.

question.content:
Consider the following figure:



[[☃ image 1]]

**What solid 3D object is produced by rotating the triangle about line $\blue m$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A right triangle with a base of three units and a height of five units. There is a dashed line, m, that overlaps the height.

hints.content: Imagine slowly rotating the triangle about $\blue m$. What 3D object will emerge?

A right triangle rotated about one of its legs results in a cone.



[[☃ image 1]]

What is its diameter?  What is its height?

options.alt: A cone with a dashed line, m, that goes through the center of the base to the apex. The dashed line is the height of a right triangle that has a base of four units and a height of eight units. The cone represents the outcome of a rotation of the triangle around line m.

hints.content: The 3D object will be a cone with diameter $8$ units.

question.content:
Consider the following figure:

$\qquad$[[☃ image 1]]

**What solid 3D object is produced by rotating the triangle about line $\blue m$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A right triangle with a base of four units and a height of eight units. There is a dashed line, m, that overlaps the height.

hints.content: Imagine slowly rotating the triangle about $\blue m$. What 3D object will emerge?

A right triangle rotated about one of its legs produces a cone.



[[☃ image 1]]

What is the radius?  What is the diameter?

options.alt: A cone with a dashed line, m, that goes through the center of the base to the apex. The dashed line is the height of a right triangle that has a base of eight units and a height of six units. The cone represents the outcome of a rotation of the triangle around line m.

hints.content: The 3D object will be a cone with radius $8$ units.

question.content:
Consider the following figure:

$\qquad$[[☃ image 1]]

**What solid 3D object is produced by rotating the triangle about line $\blue m$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A right triangle with its base of eight units and a height of six units. There is a dashed line, m, that overlaps the height.

hints.content: Imagine slowly rotating the rectangle about $\blue m$. What 3D object will emerge?

A rectangle rotated about one of its sides will result in a cylinder.



[[☃ image 1]]



What is its radius?  What is its diameter?

options.alt: A cylinder with a dashed line, m, that goes through the center of the base. The dashed line is the height of a rectangle that has a base of four units and a height of one unit. The cylinder represents the outcome of a rotation of the rectangle around line m.

hints.content: The 3D object will be a cylinder with diameter $8$ units.

question.content:
Consider the following figure:



[[☃ image 1]]

**What solid 3D object is produced by rotating the rectangle about line $\blue m$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A rectangle with its base of four units and a height of one unit. There is a dashed line, m, that overlaps the height on one side.

hints.content: Imagine slowly rotating the square about $\blue m$. What 3D object will emerge?

A rectangle rotated about one of its sides will result in a cylinder.



[[☃ image 1]]

Which measurement is the radius?  What is the diameter?

options.alt: A cylinder with a dashed line, m, that goes through the center of the base. The dashed line is the height of a square that has a base of five units and a height of five units. The cylinder represents the outcome of a rotation of the square around line m.

hints.content: The 3D object will be a cylinder with radius $5$ units.

question.content:
Consider the following figure:



[[☃ image 1]]

**What solid 3D object is produced by rotating the square about line $\blue m$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A square with its base of five units and a height of five units. There is a dashed line, m, that overlaps the height on one side.

hints.content: Imagine slowly rotating the rectangle about $\blue m$. What 3D object will emerge?

A rectangle rotated about a line passing through it and parallel to a pair of sides will result in a cylinder.



[[☃ image 1]]

What is its radius?  What is its diameter?  What is its height?

options.alt: A cylinder with a dashed line, m, that goes through the center of the base. The dashed line is the height of a rectangle that has a base of two units and a height of three units. The cylinder represents the outcome of a rotation of the rectangle around line m.

hints.content: The 3D object will be a cylinder with diameter $4$ units.

question.content:
Consider the following figure:



[[☃ image 1]]

**What solid 3D object is produced by rotating the rectangle about line $\blue m$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A rectangle with its base of three units and a height of two units. There is a dashed line, m, that overlaps the base on the bottom.

hints.content: Imagine slowly rotating the circle about $\blue m$. What 3D object will emerge?

A circle rotated about its diameter will result in a sphere.


[[☃ image 1]]

What is the radius?  What is the diameter?

options.alt: A sphere with a distance from the surface to the center being two units. A  dashed line labeled m passes through the sphere passing the center to the other side.

hints.content: The 3D object will be a sphere with radius $2$ units.

question.content:
Consider the following figure:



[[☃ image 1]]

**What solid 3D object is produced by rotating the circle $360\degree$ about line $\blue m$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]  
[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
A hemisphere (sometimes also called half-sphere or semi-sphere) is a sphere cut in half.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A half of a sphere called a hemisphere.
A circle with a radius of two units. A dashed line labeled m passes through the center.

hints.content: Imagine slowly rotating the semicircle about $\blue m$. What 3D object will emerge?

A semicircle rotated about its diameter will result in a sphere.


[[☃ image 1]]

What is the radius?  What is the diameter?

options.alt: A sphere with a distance from the surface to the center being five units. A dashed line labeled m passes through the sphere passing the center to the other side. Half of the sphere is shaded.

hints.content: The 3D object will be a sphere with radius $5$ units.

question.content:
Consider the following figure:


[[☃ image 1]]

**What solid 3D object is produced by rotating the semicircle $360\degree$ about line $\blue m$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]  
[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
A hemisphere (sometimes also called half-sphere or semi-sphere) is a sphere cut in half.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A half of a sphere called a hemisphere.
A half of a circle with a radius of five units. A dashed line labeled m passes through the center.

hints.content: Imagine slowly rotating the quarter-circle about $\blue m$. What 3D object will emerge?

[[☃ image 1]]

What is the radius of the figure?  What is the diameter?

options.alt: A half of a sphere called a hemisphere with a radius of five units. A dashed line labeled m passes through the center. Half of the hemisphere is shaded.

hints.content: The 3D object will be a hemisphere with diameter $10$ units.

question.content:
Consider the following figure:



[[☃ image 1]]

**What solid 3D object is produced by rotating the quarter-circle $360\degree$ about line $\blue m$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]  
[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
A hemisphere (sometimes also called half-sphere or semi-sphere) is a sphere cut in half.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A half of a sphere called a hemisphere.
A fourth of a circle with a radius of five units. A dashed line labeled m passes through the center.

hints.content: Imagine slowly rotating the circle about $\blue m$. What 3D object will emerge?

Any shape rotated about a line that lies outside of it will result in a hollow 3D object.

In this case, the 3D object has cross-sections that are circles, and it looks like a tube that is bent to form a ring. We call this shape a **torus**.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A three dimensional figure that looks like a donut.

question.content:
Consider the following figure:



[[☃ image 1]]

**What solid 3D object is produced by rotating the circle about line $\blue m$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A circle with a horizontal dashed line labeled m a distance away from the circle.

choices.content:
![A three dimensional figure that looks like a donut.](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/91942cedf461a6a31fb6f497b7d238d45c2cf54d.png)  
Torus

![A three dimensional figure that looks like a cone with a smaller cylinder removed from the center.](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/f0f6e33cf4a1165c732f64c118d35e39518c48b8.png)  
Hollow cone frustum

hints.content: Imagine slowly rotating the rectangle about $\blue m$. What 3D object will emerge?

Any shape rotated about a line that lies outside of it will result in a hollow 3D object.

In this case, the 3D object has cross-sections that are rectangles, and it looks like a thin, hollow cylinder. We call this shape a **tube**.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A three dimensional figure that looks like a cylinder with a smaller cylinder removed from the center.

question.content:
Consider the following figure:



[[☃ image 1]]

**What solid 3D object is produced by rotating the rectangle about line $\blue m$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A rectangle with a horizontal dashed line labeled m a distance away from the rectangle.

choices.content:
![A three dimensional figure that looks like a donut.](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/91942cedf461a6a31fb6f497b7d238d45c2cf54d.png)  
Torus

![A three dimensional figure that looks like a cylinder with a smaller cylinder removed from the center.](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/8baf3a4059ac2670678088433f9de7ad6d1a71a0.png)  
Tube

![A three dimensional figure that looks like a cone with a smaller cylinder removed from the center.](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/f0f6e33cf4a1165c732f64c118d35e39518c48b8.png)  
Hollow cone frustum

hints.content: Imagine slowly rotating the triangle about $\blue m$. What 3D object will emerge?

Any shape rotated about a line that lies outside of it will result in a hollow 3D object.

In this case, the 3D object has cross-sections that are triangles, and it has a somewhat conical shape with a hollow cylinder at its center. We call this shape a **hollow cone frustum**.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A three dimensional figure that looks like a cone with a smaller cylinder removed from the center.

Consider the following figure:



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A right triangle with a horizontal dashed line labeled m a distance away from the triangle.

choices.content:
![A three dimensional figure that looks like a donut.](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/91942cedf461a6a31fb6f497b7d238d45c2cf54d.png)
